title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include both of the following.

  • A description that the mutant allele is only inherited from the maternal parent.
The response includes one of the following.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include all of the following.

  • An identification of an acceptable dependent variable. Acceptable dependent variables include the concentration of lactic acid in the blood and the concentration of NAD + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3960@ in the blood.

  • An identification of the control as measuring NAD + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3960@ and lactic acid levels in a group of other affected individuals treated with placebo.

  • The justification that by collecting more data, the researchers will see a more accurate trend.
The response includes only one of the following.
The response includes only two of the following.

The response includes all of the following.

  • An identification of an acceptable dependent variable. Acceptable dependent variables include the concentration of lactic acid in the blood and the concentration of NAD + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3960@ in the blood.

  • An identification of the control as measuring NAD + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3960@ and lactic acid levels in a group of other affected individuals treated with placebo.

  • The justification that by collecting more data, the researchers will see a more accurate trend.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include both of the following.

  • A description that the concentration of NAD + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3960@ increased and the concentration of lactic acid decreased.

  • 125(μmol/L) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F18@

  • A prediction that the mutation will decrease the rate of oxygen consumption by the electron transport chain.

The response includes one of the following.

  • A description that the concentration of NAD + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3960@ increased and the concentration of lactic acid decreased.

  • 125(μmol/L) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F18@

  • A prediction that the mutation will decrease the rate of oxygen consumption by the electron transport chain.

The response includes two of the following.

  • A description that the concentration of NAD + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3960@ increased and the concentration of lactic acid decreased.

  • 125(μmol/L) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F18@

  • A prediction that the mutation will decrease the rate of oxygen consumption by the electron transport chain.

The response includes all three of the following.

  • A description that the concentration of NAD + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3960@ increased and the concentration of lactic acid decreased.

  • 125(μmol/L) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F18@

  • A prediction that the mutation will decrease the rate of oxygen consumption by the electron transport chain.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include all of the following.

  • The justification that the mutation likely inhibits the rate of oxygen consumption because the electron transport chain will be less efficient, so less oxygen will be required as a terminal electron acceptor.

  • The explanation that the enzyme had decreased activity but still functioned. Increasing the amount of substrate should increase the amount of product produced. Because the vitamin was similar to NADH MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeOtaiaabgeacaqGebGaaeisaaaa@391C@ , it could bind to the active site of the enzyme and effectively increase the substrate concentration.
The response includes only one of the following.
The response includes all of the following.
